00011 template< typename T >
00012 class tlm_internal_annotated_fifo :
00013 public tlm_fifo<T> ,
00014   public virtual analysis_if<T> ,
00015   public virtual analysis_if< tlm_tag< T > * > {
00016 
00017  public:
00018   typedef tlm_tag<T> *my_tag_ptr;
00019 
00020   tlm_internal_annotated_fifo( const char *nm , int size ) :
00021     tlm_fifo<T>( nm , size ) {}
00022 
00023   void write( const T &t ) {
00024     assert( nb_can_put( (my_tag_ptr)0 ) );
00025     nb_put( t );
00026   }
00027 
00028   void write( const my_tag_ptr & ) {
00029     read_event( (my_tag_ptr)0 ).notify( sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME );
00030   }
00031 
00032 };
00033 
00034 //
00035 // From the put point of view, delayed puts are immediate. The transaction T is
00036 // considered to be in the fifo from the time at which nb_put( T , t ) was
00037 // called.
00038 //
00039 // However, from the get point of view, the effect of the delayed put is not
00040 // seen until t has expired. We cannot see the new data on the get side until
00041 // time t.
00042 //
00043 // The same rules apply to a delayed get : a get( T , t ) gets T immediately,
00044 // but the put side does not see the extra space in the fifo until time t.
00045 //
00046 // In summary : put->put and get->get is immediate, but put->get and get->put
00047 // are delayed.
00048 //
00049 // Although the precise effects of put and get may vary from channel to channel
00050 // these observability rules are part of the definition of the annotated
00051 // interfaces.
00052 //
00053 
00054 template< typename T >
00055 class tlm_annotated_fifo :
00056 public sc_core::sc_module ,
00057 public virtual tlm_annotated_put_if< T  > ,
00058 public virtual tlm_annotated_get_peek_if < T  > {
00059 
00060  public:
00061 
00062    tlm_annotated_fifo( sc_core::sc_module_name nm , int size = 1 ) :
00063      sc_core::sc_module( nm ) ,
00064      m_size( size ) ,
00065      m_fifo("internal_fifo" , size ) ,
00066      m_put_peq("put_peq") ,
00067      m_get_peq("pop_peq") {
00068 
00069      m_put_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00070      m_get_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00071 
00072   }
00073 
00074    tlm_annotated_fifo( int size = 1 ) :
00075      sc_core::sc_module( sc_core::sc_gen_unique_name("annotated_fifo") ) ,
00076      m_size( size ) ,
00077      m_fifo("internal_fifo" , size ) ,
00078      m_put_peq("put_peq") ,
00079      m_get_peq("pop_peq") {
00080 
00081      m_put_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00082      m_get_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00083 
00084   }
00085   // non annotated nb_can_* methods
00086 
00087   bool nb_can_put( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00088     return m_fifo.nb_can_put( m_put_peq.size() + m_get_peq.size() + 1 );
00089   }
00090 
00091   bool nb_can_get( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00092     return m_fifo.nb_can_get();
00093   }
00094 
00095   bool nb_can_peek( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00096     return m_fifo.nb_can_peek();
00097   }
00098 
00099   //
00100   // annotated nb_can_* methods
00101   //
00102   // these are virtual because we may want to add some additional time based
00103   // restrictions re: what can can be put and popped when : for example, we
00104   // might want to insist that we only ever post to the end of both peqs, to
00105   // preserve the ordering of the transactions.
00106   //
00107 
00108   // nb_can_put is part of the annotated non blocking put interface
00109 
00110   virtual bool nb_can_put( const sc_core::sc_time &time , tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00111     return nb_can_put();
00112   }
00113 
00114   virtual bool nb_can_get( const sc_core::sc_time &time , tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00115     return nb_can_get();
00116   }
00117 
00118   // ok_to_* methods
00119 
00120   const sc_core::sc_event &ok_to_put(  tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00121     return m_fifo.ok_to_put();
00122   }
00123 
00124   const sc_core::sc_event &ok_to_get(  tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00125     return m_fifo.ok_to_get();
00126   }
00127 
00128   const sc_core::sc_event &ok_to_peek(  tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00129     return m_fifo.ok_to_peek();
00130   }
00131 
00132   // non annotated nonblocking put, get + peek
00133 
00134   bool nb_put( const T &t ) {
00135 
00136     if( !nb_can_put() ) {
00137       return false;
00138     }
00139 
00140     assert( m_fifo.nb_can_put() );
00141     m_fifo.nb_put( t );
00142     return true;
00143 
00144   }
00145 
00146   bool nb_get( T &t ) {
00147 
00148     if( !nb_can_get() ) {
00149       return false;
00150     }
00151 
00152     assert( m_fifo.nb_can_get() );
00153     m_fifo.nb_get( t );
00154     return true;
00155 
00156   }
00157 
00158   bool nb_peek( T &t ) const {
00159     return m_fifo.nb_peek( t );
00160   }
00161 
00162   // annotated nonblocking methods
00163 
00164 
00165   bool nb_put( const T &transaction , const sc_core::sc_time &time ) {
00166 
00167     if( !nb_can_put( time ) ) {
00168       return false;
00169     }
00170 
00171     m_put_peq.write( transaction , time );
00172     return true;
00173 
00174   }
00175 
00176   virtual bool nb_get( T &transaction , const sc_core::sc_time &time ) {
00177     static tlm_tag<T> *t;
00178 
00179     if( !m_fifo.nb_get_no_notify( transaction ) ) {
00180       return false;
00181     }
00182 
00183     m_get_peq.write( t , time );
00184     return true;
00185 
00186   }
00187 
00188   // blocking put, get and peek
00189 
00190   void put( const T &t ) {
00191     while( !nb_put( t ) ) {
00192       wait( ok_to_put() );
00193     }
00194   }
00195 
00196   T get( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) {
00197 
00198     T trans;
00199 
00200     while( !nb_get( trans ) ) {
00201       wait( ok_to_get() );
00202     }
00203 
00204     return trans;
00205   }
00206 
00207   T peek( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00208     return m_fifo.peek();
00209   }
00210 
00211   int size() { return m_size; }
00212 
00213  private:
00214   int m_size;
00215 
00216  protected: // to allow for overriding of annotated can_put and can_get
00217 
00218   tlm_internal_annotated_fifo<T> m_fifo;
00219 
00220   tlm_peq<T> m_put_peq;
00221   tlm_peq< tlm_tag<T> *> m_get_peq;
00222 
00223 };

00225 } // namespace tlm
